ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Function-oriented Make-like declarative workflows for Statistics and data science are supported in the 'targets' R package. As an extension to 'targets', the 'tarchetypes' package provides convenient user-side functions to make 'targets' easier to use. By establishing reusable archetypes for common kinds of targets and pipelines, these functions help express complicated reproducible workflows concisely and compactly. The methods in this package were influenced by the 'drake' R package by Will Landau (2018) <doi:10.21105/joss.00550>.

Function-oriented Make-like declarative workflows for Statistics and data science are supported in the 'targets' R package. As an extension to 'targets', the 'tarchetypes' package provides convenient user-side functions to make 'targets' easier to use. By establishing reusable archetypes for common kinds of targets and pipelines, these functions help express complicated reproducible workflows concisely and compactly. The methods in this package were influenced by the 'drake' R package by Will Landau (2018) <doi:10.21105/joss.00550>.

name: r-tarchetypes
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.14.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-tarchetypes
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/tarchetypes_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/tarchetypes/tarchetypes_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: d2013b998fb597b1490406391eb5ead51413e949d508b5c5864e2dd20041915c

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-digest >=0.6.25
    - r-dplyr >=1.0.0
    - r-fs >=1.4.2
    - r-furrr >=0.3.0
    - r-future >=1.0.0
    - r-future.callr >=0.2.0
    - r-rlang >=0.4.7
    - r-targets >=0.14.0
    - r-tibble >=3.0.1
    - r-tidyselect >=1.1.0
    - r-vctrs >=0.3.4
    - r-withr >=2.1.2
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-digest >=0.6.25
    - r-dplyr >=1.0.0
    - r-fs >=1.4.2
    - r-furrr >=0.3.0
    - r-future >=1.0.0
    - r-future.callr >=0.2.0
    - r-rlang >=0.4.7
    - r-targets >=0.14.0
    - r-tibble >=3.0.1
    - r-tidyselect >=1.1.0
    - r-vctrs >=0.3.4
    - r-withr >=2.1.2

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('tarchetypes')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('tarchetypes')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://docs.ropensci.org/tarchetypes/
  dev_url: https://github.com/ropensci/tarchetypes
  license: MIT
  summary: Function-oriented Make-like declarative workflows for Statistics and data science are supported in the 'targets' R package. As an extension to 'targets', the 'tarchetypes' package provides convenient user-side functions to make 'targets' easier to use. By establishing reusable archetypes for common kinds of 
    targets and pipelines, these functions help express complicated reproducible workflows concisely and compactly. The methods in this package were influenced by the 'drake' R package by Will Landau (2018) <doi:10.21105/joss.00550>.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - brendanf
    - wlandau
